com.example.user.schachapp.chessLogic

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.user.schachapp.chessLogic.Position

  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a position on a chessboard, meaning both coordinates should be between 0-7

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Position(int x, int y)
      Creates the position from the given coordinates.
      Position(java.lang.String representation)
      Creates the position from given string representation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Position compareTo)
      Compares a given position to this one by comparing their coordinates.
      int getX() 
      int getY() 
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the string representation for a chess game of this position by converting the x-coordinate to a letter and incrementing the y-coordinate by one

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • Position

        public Position(java.lang.String representation)
        Creates the position from given string representation. Checks if the position is correct.
        Parameters:

        public Position(int x,
                int y)
        Creates the position from the given coordinates. Checks if the coordinates are correct.

        y - y-coordinate (vertical)

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation for a chess game of this position by converting the x-coordinate to a letter and incrementing the y-coordinate by one

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Position compareTo)
        Compares a given position to this one by comparing their coordinates.
        Parameters:
        compareTo - the position to be compared
        Returns:
        true if give position is equal to this one, false if not
